root.TEXT:
Record date: 2078-08-21
Patient Name: HARDY,TERESA [ MRN: 36052413AGH ]
Date of Visit: 08/21/2078
CC: here for f/u HTN, DM, CAD; preop for eye surgery 9/19/2078
HPI: 58 yo F h/o DM T2, hypercholesterolemia, CHF, CAD s/p angioplasty. She is scheduled fro eye surgery with Dr. Urbach on 9/19/2078. She needs an EKG, UA, CBC, SMA7.
With respects to her CV issues, she is taking imdur 30 mg qd, lisinopril 40 mg qd, lasix 80 BID, and atenolol 100 mg po qd. She is also taking ASA 325 mg po qd. I advised her she should stop taking ASA 14 days prior to surgery. She denies any CP, SOB, nausea, vomiting.
Re: DM T2, she reports that her FS have been as low as 106 basically in AMs, and as high as 300-400s in the PMs. She is taking glyburide 5 mg 2 tablets QAM. Last HGA1C 13 in June 2078.
RE: Arthritis; she takes ultram 50 mg q 6 hours occasionally. I instructed patient NOT to take ultram 14 days prior to eye surgery.
Had mammogram recently 7/28/2078 and unremarkable.
ROS: as above: lost approximately 10 lbs since spring 2078.
================ Problems ================
Coronary artery disease
Angioplasty
CHF
Diabetes
Hypercholesterolemia
Abnormal mammogram

Abnormal pap test

EKG: NSR R 60s, await formal reading
A/P:
1. DMT2: HGA1C 13 6/2078. Will d/c glyburide, and start metformin 500 mg po BID. Advised her to not take AM dose the morning of the eye surgery and may resume PM dose prior to supper that evening. She understands. Hopefully with BID dose her DM will be better controlled, particularly in afternoon. AlkPhos 124 mildy elevated 6/2078 but normalized now and should be fine with metformin. New script for metformin given.
2. CV: HTN, CAD s/p angioplasty. WIll check EKG today. She is asymptomatic at this time. Advised to hold ASA 14 days prior to eye surgery.
3. Arthritis: advised to hold ultram 14 days prior to surgery. May take tylenol for pain relief instead.
4. Ophthalmology: scheduled for eye surgery wtih Dr. Urbach 9/19/2078. Preop performed and await labs as above, including UA, CBC, SMA7, LFTs, EKG, and Coags ( see labs above for results)
5. pyuria: mild UTI: levo 250 mg po qd x 3 days disp #3 tablets.
6. RTC week of September 11-13 ( one week prior to scheduled eye surgery) to reevaluate her FS and DM
______________________________
Yolanda Heather Lanier, M.D.
